sources.title: Gasoline Alley (1951) CLASSIC COMEDY
sources.description:
CLASSIC FAMILY COMEDY
Director: Edward Bernds
Starring: Don Beddoe, Jimmy Lydon, Susan Morrow, Scotty Beckett

The popular Frank O. King comic strip goes from page to screen in this Columbia Pictures feature by legendary comedy director Edward Bernds. The storyline reflects traditional American values, and centers on the family of patriarch Walt Wallet, along with the others residents of Gasoline Alley. See ya in the Funny Pages.

TRIVIA: Created by Frank O. King, Gasoline Alley debuted on November 24, 1918, and is the longest-running comic strip in the United States still in publication.

metadata.Plot: The popular Frank O. King comic strip characters go from newspaper page to screen in this 1951 feature film from legendary comedy director Edward Bernds (of Three Stooges and Bowery Boys fame). Scotty Beckett and Jimmy Lydon are Corky and Skeezix, half-brothers who find themselves in the restaurant business until complications and some family conflicts arise.
metadata.Actors: Scotty Beckett, Jimmy Lydon, Susan Morrow
